intro: Treichelia longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract treichelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Treichelia longibracteata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
